movies.title: The Troops in New York
movies.plot: After being chosen to represent France in an international congress, Cruchot and his troops must go to New York, and adapt to its social and cultural aspects.
movies.simplePlot: After being chosen to represent France in an international congress, Cruchot and his troops must go to New York, and adapt to its social and cultural aspects.

biography.birthName: Louis Germain de Funès de Galarza
biography.bio: Louis Germain David de Funès de Galarza was born on July 31, 1914, in Courbevoie, France. His father, named Carlos Luis de Funes de Galarza, was a former lawyer of Seville, Spain, who became a diamond cutter. His mother, named Leonor Soto Reguera, was of Spanish and Portugese extraction. Young Louis de Funès was fond of drawing and piano playing. He dropped out of school and worked various jobs, mostly as a jazz pianist at Pigalle, making his customers laugh every time he made a grimace. He studied acting for one year at the Simon acting school. There he made some useful contacts, including Daniel Gélin among others. During the occupation of Paris in the Second World War, he continued his piano studies at a music school, where he fell in love with a secretary, named Jeanne de Maupassant, a grand-niece of writer Guy de Maupassant. She had fallen in love with "the young man who played jazz like god"; they married in 1943, and had two sons born in 1944 and 1949. Funès continued playing piano at clubs, knowing there wasn't much call for a short, balding, skinny actor. His wife and Daniel Gelin encouraged him until he managed to overcome his rejection. He made his film debut in 1945, at the age of 31, and went on playing about one hundred film roles in the next twenty years. Louis de Funès shot to international fame in the 1960's after his roles in such slapstick comedies as 'Le gendarme de St. Tropez' (The Gendarme of St. Tropez 1964) and the Fantomas (1964) trilogy. He brilliantly portrayed a funny French policeman, whose hilarious hyperactivity, uncontrolled anger, and sardonic laughter produced a highly comic effect. Funès was voted the most favorite actor in France in 1968, and remained very popular in Europe during the 1970's. He also continued to play on stage during his career as a film star, and was acclaimed for his stage works in classic French theatre. Funès was instrumental in making film adaptations of such theatre plays as 'Oscar continues' and the Moliere's 'Le Misere', among other plays. Nicknamed "the man with the forty faces per minute", Louis de Funès played bit parts in over eighty films, before he got his first leading roles, eventually becoming the leading French comedian. He co-starred with the major French actors of the time, including Jean Marais and Mylène Demongeot in the Fantomas trilogy, and also Jean Gabin, Fernandel, Bourvil, Coluche, Annie Girardot, and Yves Montand. Funès's collaboration with director 'Gerard Oury' produced a memorable tandem of Funès-Bourvil. He also worked with Jean Girault in the famous 'Gendarmes' series. In a departure from the Gendarme image, Funès collaborated with Claude Zidi, who wrote for him a new character full of nuances and frankness in L'aile ou la cuisse (1976), which is arguably the best of his roles. Funès played over 130 roles in film and over 100 roles on stage. From 1943-1983 Louis de Funès was married to Jeanne Barthelemy de Maupassant. Their son, named 'Olivier De Funes' , had a brief acting career before becoming a pilot with Air France, his other son, named Patric de Funes, became a medical doctor. Louis de Funès was also a rose grower, a variety of roses has been named the "Louis de Funès rose" after him. He died of a heart attack and complications of a stroke on January 27, 1983, in Nantes, France. He was laid to rest in the Cimetière du Cellier, and a monument of him was erected in the rose-garden of his wife's castle.
biography.name: Louis de Funès

biography.placeOfBirth: Safi, French Protectorate of Morocco [now Morocco]
biography.bio: Michel Galabru was born on October 27, 1922 in Safi, French Protectorate of Morocco as Michel Louis Edmond Galabru. He was an actor and writer, known for Asterix and Obelix vs. Caesar (1999), Subway (1985) and Belle Epoque (1992). He was married to Claude and Anne Jacquot. He died on January 4, 2016 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Michel Galabru

biography.bio: Christian Marin was born on February 8, 1929 in Lyon, Rhône, France. He was an actor, known for The Aeronauts (1967), The Troops in New York (1965) and Le gendarme se marie (1968). He died on September 5, 2012 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Christian Marin

biography.bio: Guy Grosso was born on August 19, 1933 in Beauvais, Oise, France as Guy Sarrazin. He was an actor and writer, known for The Troops on Vacation (1970), The Troops in New York (1965) and The Troops & Aliens (1979). He died on February 14, 2001.
biography.name: Guy Grosso

biography.bio: Michel Modo was born on March 30, 1937 in Carpentras, Vaucluse, France as Michel Henri Louis Goi. He was an actor and writer, known for My Father's Glory (1990), The Troops in New York (1965) and The Troops & Aliens (1979). He died on September 24, 2008 in Vaires-sur-Marne, Seine-et-Marne, France.
biography.name: Michel Modo

biography.bio: Alan Scott was born on October 13, 1922 in Haddonfield, New Jersey, USA. He is an actor, known for Lola (1961), The Troops in New York (1965) and Knife of Ice (1972).
biography.name: Alan Scott

biography.bio: Jean Lefebvre was born on October 3, 1919 in Valenciennes, Nord, France as Jean Marcel Lefebvre. He was an actor, known for Diabolique (1955), Le gendarme se marie (1968) and The Troops on Vacation (1970). He was married to Brigitte Lerebours, Yori Bertin and Micheline Grasser. He died on July 9, 2004 in Marrakech, Morocco.
biography.name: Jean Lefebvre

biography.bio: Geneviève Grad was born on July 5, 1944 in Paris, France as Geneviève Gabrielle Grad. She is an actress, known for The Troops of St. Tropez (1964), Le gendarme se marie (1968) and The Troops in New York (1965). She has been married to Jean René André Yvon Guillaume since March 19, 1993.
biography.name: Geneviève Grad

biography.bio: Marino Masé was born on March 21, 1939 in Trieste, Italy. He is an actor, known for The Godfather: Part III (1990), Les Carabiniers (1963) and Fists in the Pocket (1965).
biography.name: Marino Masé

biography.bio: Mario Pisu was born on May 21, 1910 in Montecchio Emilia, Italy. He is known for his work on 8½ (1963), Juliet of the Spirits (1965) and The Organizer (1963). He died on July 17, 1976 in Velletri, Italy.
biography.name: Mario Pisu

biography.bio: Albert Augier was born on February 29, 1924 in Paris, France. He is known for his work on Love and Death (1975), Spartakus and the Sun Beneath the Sea (1985) and Astérix chez les Bretons (1986). He died on February 2, 2007 in Paris.
biography.name: Albert Augier

biography.bio: Jean-Pierre Bertrand is an actor and producer, known for The Troops of St. Tropez (1964), The Troops in New York (1965) and Le gendarme se marie (1968).
biography.name: Jean-Pierre Bertrand

biography.bio: Jean Droze was born on June 26, 1925 in Luçon, Vendée, France. He was an actor, known for The Sucker (1965), The Troops of St. Tropez (1964) and The Troops in New York (1965). He died on November 3, 1995 in Draveil, Essonne, France.
biography.name: Jean Droze

biography.bio: Leroy Haynes was born on January 7, 1914 in Clinton, Kentucky, USA. He was an actor, known for The Troops in New York (1965), Frenchie King (1971) and Trois chambres à Manhattan (1965). He died in April 1986 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Leroy Haynes

biography.bio: Billy Kearns was born on February 17, 1923 in Seattle, Washington, USA as William R. Kearns. He was an actor, known for The Trial (1962), Purple Noon (1960) and Marathon Man (1976). He died on November 28, 1992 in Château d'Oex, Switzerland.
biography.name: Billy Kearns

filmingLocations.location: Paris Studios Cinéma, Billancourt, Hauts-de-Seine, France
